posts.post_content: How about this? Cast an aura on a creature (say, [Eldrazi Conscrip](/Pages/Card/Details.aspx?multiverseid=193492)tion), then cast [Mycosynth Lattice](/Pages/Card/Details.aspx?name=Mycosynth Lattice), then cast this. The aura becomes an artifact, and then it becomes an equipment. It's already attached to a creature, so you don't need to equip it. The creature now gets two completely independent bonuses from the same card, giving it a total of +18/+10 (and trample and annihilate). And you can move it to another creature (gaining both the aura bonus and the equip bonus) using the equip ability.
posts.html:
How about this? Cast an aura on a creature (say, Eldrazi Conscription), then cast Mycosynth Lattice, then cast this. The aura becomes an artifact, and then it becomes an equipment. It's already attached to a creature, so you don't need to equip it. The creature now gets two completely independent bonuses from the same card, giving it a total of +18/+10 (and trample and annihilate). And you can move it to another creature (gaining both the aura bonus and the equip bonus) using the equip ability.

posts.post_content: Let's see what combos we could do. [Mycosynth Lattice](/Pages/Card/Details.aspx?name=Mycosynth Lattice) and [Goblin Gaveleer](/Pages/Card/Details.aspx?name=Goblin Gaveleer) are obvious, putting all those lands on him for the ultimate land hammer. But let's go boros by putting in [Puresteel Paladin](/Pages/Card/Details.aspx?name=Puresteel Paladin) to make sure mana wouldn't be a problem and proceed to spam artifacts with [Prototype Portal](/Pages/Card/Details.aspx?name=Prototype Portal) and good old [Darksteel Forge](/Pages/Card/Details.aspx?name=Darksteel Forge).
posts.html:

posts.post_content:
A couple of crazy, hilarious combos:  
  
Using [Mycosynth Lattice](/Pages/Card/Details.aspx?name=Mycosynth Lattice) to make [Karn Liberated](/Pages/Card/Details.aspx?name=Karn Liberated) an artifact and Bludgeon Brawl to make him an Equipment, you can attach him to [Karn, Silver Golem](/Pages/Card/Details.aspx?name=Karn, Silver Golem), giving him +7/+0. Karn hits his enemies with himself. The same thing works with [Venser, Shaper Savant](/Pages/Card/Details.aspx?name=Venser, Shaper Savant) and [Venser, the Sojourner](/Pages/Card/Details.aspx?name=Venser, the Sojourner) and [Nicol Bolas](/Pages/Card/Details.aspx?name=Nicol Bolas) and [Nicol Bolas, Planeswalker](/Pages/Card/Details.aspx?name=Nicol Bolas, Planeswalker). [Gideon Jura](/Pages/Card/Details.aspx?name=Gideon Jura) can also temporarily equip another Planeswalker by becoming a creature with his ultimate.  
  
It gets even better when using a Goblin Gaveleer: He can dual-wield Nicol Bolas and Karn, getting +19/+0. He hits for 20. That has got to be the most hilarious win con I've ever heard.  
  
To make things even more hilarious, you can equip the Lattice and Brawl themselves to your creatures. "Taste my apparently metallic enchantment that somehow allows me to wield i... [(see all)](javascript:void(0);)
posts.html:
A couple of crazy, hilarious combos:

Using Mycosynth Lattice to make Karn Liberated an artifact and Bludgeon Brawl to make him an Equipment, you can attach him to Karn, Silver Golem, giving him +7/+0. Karn hits his enemies with himself. The same thing works with Venser, Shaper Savant and Venser, the Sojourner and Nicol Bolas and Nicol Bolas, Planeswalker. Gideon Jura can also temporarily equip another Planeswalker by becoming a creature with his ultimate.

It gets even better when using a Goblin Gaveleer: He can dual-wield Nicol Bolas and Karn, getting +19/+0. He hits for 20. That has got to be the most hilarious win con I've ever heard.
